title: Chelsea news: Frank Lampard demands more from Tammy Abraham despite goal vs Southampton
text:
Tammy Abraham scored his eighth Premier League goal of the season against Southampton (Picture: AFP)

Frank Lampard has insisted that there is more to come from Tammy Abraham despite the striker scoring his ninth goal of the season during Chelsea’s 4-1 win over Southampton.

The 21-year-old has been in a rich vein of form this season and continued his excellent run in front of goal to hand Chelsea the lead at St Mary’s with a clever lob over Angus Gunn.

Goals from Mason Mount, N’Golo Kante and Michy Batshuayi cancelled out a Danny Ings strike for Southampton to ensure a comfortable victory for Lampard’s side on the south coast.

Abraham’s goal was awarded after goal-line technology (Picture: Getty)

Although Lampard is adamant that Abraham can still improve, he admitted that he has established himself ahead of Batshuayi and Olivier Giroud in Chelsea’s striker pecking order

Speaking post-match, Lampard said: ‘When people are in form, that happens. People were questioning him, but he is not just an incredible handful for defenders, he is getting his goals as well.

‘I trusted him at the start of the season. He also has Giroud and Batshuayi there, and he has made the place his own at the moment. I will keep on him because I want more.

‘He took a whack on the back of the knee, but he is ok. I think he wanted the applause.’

After spending three seasons on loan to Bristol City, Swansea City and Aston Villa, Abraham has finally been given an opportunity at Chelsea and he has certainly made the most of it.

Lampard was delighted with Chelsea’s win against Southampton at St Mary’s (Picture: PA)

Following his double against Southampton, Abraham is the joint-leading goalscorer in the Premier League alongside Sergio Aguero and his form has led to a call-up to the England squad.

Abraham credited his teammates for his call-up, saying: ‘It’s been fantastic, I give it [the call-up] to my teammates, the manager, all the staff, everyone who has believed in me.

‘I give it to my team, they are always providing me with chances when you play with such great players you always get chances.’
